channel.title: Split one control to more outs, controlled by switches
channel.description:
Hi! I can't find an appropriate module for this, can you please help? I need this setup: Input: 1 control in (blue), 3 Switches Output: 3 control outs (blue) - select by Switch on/off which one
So, basically, I want to switch the blue controller input (1 controller) to 3 outs (3 controllers), dependable on the switch input (1 to 3). With which object can I achieve this?

item.title: Split one control to more outs, controlled by switches
item.dc:creator: @baxgas
item.description:
@baxgas wrote:

Thanks, I reinstalled axoloti, and it seems fine now (I think also some other objects were missing from my setup). Yes, it is uppercase TSG and case-sensitive, but could easily be found now.
I'll try to patch up some switchers.

Read full topic
item.source: Split one control to more outs, controlled by switches

item.title: Split one control to more outs, controlled by switches
item.dc:creator: @reubenfinger
item.description:
@reubenfinger wrote:

Odd, they appear in my library, is it just this object or all of his contributions, can anyone else confirm an issue with theslowgrowths contributions? The library is case sensitive, tripped me up on a few occasions, hopefully it's just that.

here's the object in the meantime
MultiPot 3.axo (6.3 KB)

Read full topic
item.source: Split one control to more outs, controlled by switches

item.title: Split one control to more outs, controlled by switches
item.dc:creator: @baxgas
item.description:
@baxgas wrote:

Thanks, but I can't access these objects, as I see it was an issue also for others

TheSlowGrowth contributions

Hey, apparently this part of the community library is missing in my folder... Is there a way to download these tools - I am sorry, if the answer is obvious but I haven't seen a download link or something like this - thx

Read full topic
item.source: Split one control to more outs, controlled by switches

item.title: Split one control to more outs, controlled by switches
item.dc:creator: @reubenfinger
item.description:
@reubenfinger wrote:

You need a Hook object. there are a few variants, the best for you is TSG/ctrl/MultiPot 3 this does what you need, there are other options for sending more or less, use the search term hook

the multipot: http://www.privatepublic.de/public/community-objectlist.html#o-1065883761

Read full topic
